p: Corticosteroids are one of the main class of drugs used for chronic inflammatory diseases and immune disorders. Their anti-inflammatory effects are attributed to activating the transcription of anti-inflammatory genes and suppressing pro-inflammatory genes through modulation of histone acetylation [ 220]. For pneumonia, systemic corticosteroids can be used as an adjuvant to antibiotics, with an analysis of randomized control studies showing that corticosteroids reduce both mortality and morbidity in adults with severe community acquired pneumonia [ 221].
